thread.title: Will Deaths at Retirement Become Gender Neutral?

author: wsjcom
title: Will Deaths at Retirement Become Gender Neutral?
text:
Regarding “Why So Many U.S. Men Die at Age 62” (Journal Report, Feb. 12): I think the problem men of my generation had with retiring was the sudden cut off of their life focus. Women in my age group were more likely to be the stay-at-home person who took care of the family. As their responsibilities lessened, they gradually built up a social life, so when they got older it wasn’t a drastic adjustment for them as it was for men when they retired.
The question today is, with a much greater percentage of women in the workplace,...
